Well, it might be a little tricky when considering the reference frame. Its easy on the ground... you can use the planets "away from center"-vector. But in space you have to consider stuff like rotating planets...

Your timewarp system works for interplanetary travel, but if some obnoxious user decides to timewarp out, they have effectively avoided anything headed there way. Say you shoot a missile at someone, once they see ti coming, they can timewarp, and the missile never hits them.

Timewarp won't work with PvP and KSP isn't designed for PvP as well. Opposed to what modern media is suggesting are space battles pretty boring anyway (was it a manley vid?)

So we might should just have a nice MP for the beginning and someone can later try to figure out PvP.

I think there will be an option for this.

But, I don't understand your example.

I think with time warps.... just having whoever is local to one another, check their times... if they are not at the same time they don't show up to one another, if they are in the same area but at different game times a pop-up a box will list them and if you want to sync to the other players time you click the name and click sync.

If one player warps, they just stop being updated by any player not at the same time as they are.

This is very simple and realistic. Furthermore: Say Billy is on the moon, mining Keth, and Jim-bob wants to join him, all he needs to do is get to the moon, in the same general area, and bring up the sync time window. Jim-Bob selects Billy who is 3 days ahead, and then clicks 'sync time' and ta daa! they can see one another.

Problem of warp is solved. (basically).

KSP may not be designed for war but that's why we have mods So PVP is staying in my list of hopefuls for this project or other projects that might come after. It's up there with Spore-like civilization building in different star systems (for multiplayer at least, SP can stay just Kerbin)

On a side note: Do you guys have any idea's on maybe bridging architecture/features with Kerbal Live Feed. I don't mean taking code necessarily (because that's in all probability impossible) but things like an active player listing with location details (what they are flying/building/crashing) as well as orbital map information? While I believe things would be low priority for you now I think they could be cool things to help flesh out the multiplayer. Also I would like to second the question about how you think mods would fair with L.O.G. as I believe that is something that is hugely important.

Those are some good questions.

I will try to answer them as good as I can:

The server software will be downloadable by anyone. You will be able to use any mod on your server, as long as everyone on the server has got it.

How we will solve this in particular is not cleared yet.

PvP will work. If we don't find any better solution, you will just be able to turn off timewarp to make war possible.

Yes, will implement Chat and things like they have in KLF. That's necessary to make a good MP.

But, it's low priority.
